thread.title: DOUG CHAPMAN HONORED: Longtime tennis coach named to USTA "No-Cut" team.
thread.title_full: DOUG CHAPMAN HONORED: Longtime tennis coach named to USTA "No-Cut" team.

title: DOUG CHAPMAN HONORED: Longtime tennis coach named to USTA "No-Cut" team.
text: DOUG CHAPMAN HONORED: Longtime tennis coach named to USTA "No-Cut" team. Comment The Herald News, Fall River, MA Writer Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 12:03 PM Updated at 10:21 AM Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 12:03 PM Updated at 10:21 AM SOMERSET – Doug Chapman, Somerset Berkley Regional's longtime boys' head tennis coach, has been named to the USTA’s 2015 No-Cut Coach All-Star Team. The No-Cut Coach All-Star Team recognizes 12 middle and high school coaches throughout the nation who implement a “no-cut” policy which welcomes all interested students to be a part of their school’s tennis team. The No-Cut Coach All-Star Team was established in 2013. Coaches are nominated by their respective USTA Section A Somerset resident, Chapman has been a coach at Somerset Berkley Regional High School for 37 years, with a coaching record of 573-189, the most wins of any tennis coach in Massachusetts high school history. The Massachusetts sports editor of the Providence Journal from 1982-2001. Chapman is a graduate of Boston University and Somerset High School. He is also women's tennis coach at the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth. The Herald News, Fall River, MA Writer Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 12:03 PM Updated at 10:21 AM
